intro: Trichoscypha linderi, commonly known as the African sand dollar tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and dense, rounded crown. The plant has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by distinctive, spiny fruits that split open to release seeds. Trichoscypha linderi is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
